;周日，数万名西班牙人在马德里抗议，反对代理总理佩德罗·桑切斯可能制定的特赦计划加泰罗尼亚分离主义者在选举失败后试图保住自己的职位。

;

;反对派保守派人民党 (PP) 的支持者挥舞着西班牙国旗，从西班牙各地赶来参加在马德里举行的集会。当局估计人群规模为 40,000 人。

;

;桑切斯在 7 月份的选举中获得第二名，如果他赢得流亡的前加泰罗尼亚领导人卡莱斯·普伊格德蒙特 (Carles Puigdemont) 的支持，他可以继续留任。控制着议会的七个席位。

;

;普伊格蒙特因试图分裂该地区而在西班牙被通缉，他要求放弃针对其他分裂分子的法律行动，作为他获得支持的条件。

;

;阿尔贝托·努涅斯7 月 23 日赢得最多选票的人民党领导人 Feijoo 表示，他绝不会同意对加泰罗尼亚 2017 年独立公投组织者的特赦要求，尽管法院裁定公投非法，但公投还是举行了。

;< p>;他在马德里集会上对支持者表示，撤回针对分离主义者的刑事案件就相当于对“政变策划者”进行特赦。

;

;72 岁的格雷戈里奥·卡斯特内达 (Gregorio Casteneda) 是一名养老金领取者，来自西班牙北部的桑坦德 (Santander)。海岸以表明他反对任何特赦。

;

;“我不赞成我们现在的政府。对我来说，这是一场灾难，因为它将彻底分裂西班牙，”他告诉路透社。

;

;桑切斯周日在加泰罗尼亚地区首府巴塞罗那附近的加瓦举行了自己的政治集会。他没有提到特赦，但表示社会党希望弥合加泰罗尼亚危机的社会分歧。

;

;他对支持者说：“我们正在努力翻开新的一页。”

;

;2021 年，桑切斯赦免了九名分离主义者因在独立运动中所扮演的角色而入狱。

;

;费乔将在 9 月 27 日首次投票选举总理，但由于人民党反对任何选举，他获胜的机会被认为很小。对分离主义者让步。如果 Feijoo 失败，桑切斯将有机会看看他是否可以召集支持。

;;周日（9月24日），科索沃总理称该地区一个村庄发生枪击事件，一名警察被杀，另一名警察受伤，北约部队与欧盟警察部队、欧盟驻科法治团成员和科索沃警察一起在科索沃北部的一条道路上巡逻。 ;
;

;周日早些时候，约30名“全副武装”男子在科索沃北部一个村庄向科索沃警察开枪，造成一名警察死亡，同一批武装人员还袭击了附近的塞尔维亚东正教教堂修道院发生;5月以来首次发生此类重大区域暴力事件;，科索沃官员说。

;

;科索沃总理阿尔宾·库尔蒂和内政部长谢拉尔·斯韦克拉将村里警察的袭击和修道院的袭击归咎于“塞尔维亚支持的犯罪分子”。< /p>;

;塞尔维亚东正教拉斯卡-普里兹伦教区表示，蒙面男子乘坐装甲车强行进入巴尼斯卡附近的修道院。该教区表示，为了安全起见，牧师和朝圣者将自己锁在修道院的寺庙内，并补充说，偶尔会听到枪声，武装人员在修道院的庭院周围走动。

;

;目前无法立即确定是否有人在修道院受伤或死亡。

;

;塞尔维亚官员没有立即对此事件做出反应。预计武契奇总统将很快发表声明。

;

;“至少有 30 人全副武装。他们是专业人士，有军事和警察背景，”库尔蒂说，他早些时候将该组织描述为“恐怖分子” .

;

;他说，袭击者在修道院被科索沃警察包围，警察敦促他们投降。

;

;当地媒体报道称，边防警察已经关闭了与塞尔维亚的两个重要过境点。

;

; p>;

;联合国驻科索沃特派团团长卡罗琳·齐亚德对这名警察的丧生表示深切哀悼，并以最强烈的措辞谴责这一事件。

;

;紧张局势一直处于高度紧张状态自;冲突以来，在前塞尔维亚省科索沃; 5月，90多名北约维和士兵和约50名塞族抗议者在科索沃北部受伤。

;

;阿尔巴尼亚族占科索沃人口的90%以上，其中塞族占多数仅在计划成立塞族占多数的城市协会的北部地区。

;

;事件发生后，可以看到北约部队以及欧盟警察部队欧盟驻科法治团和科索沃警察在通往巴尼斯卡的道路上巡逻据路透社记者报道。

;

;欧盟发起的关于塞尔维亚和科索沃这两个战时敌人之间关系正常化的谈判上周陷入僵局，欧盟指责库尔蒂未能建立塞族占多数的联盟自治市，这将给予他们更多的自治权。;了解更多;

;亚洲奥林匹克理事会 (OCA) 表示很高兴朝鲜国旗继续在杭州亚运会上飘扬尽管该国因不遵守全球反兴奋剂规则而被禁止参加比赛。

;

;世界反兴奋剂机构 (WADA) 禁止在奥运会和残奥会之外的所有重大体育赛事中悬挂国旗，在认为朝鲜未能实施有效的测试计划后，将在 2021 年举行。

;

;但在周六于杭州举行的开幕式上，朝鲜运动员在国旗后面自豪地行进，并在比赛和运动员村进行了展示。

;

;亚奥理事会代理主席兰迪尔·辛格表示，亚运会组织者和朝鲜正在与世界反兴奋剂机构进行讨论，但旗帜仍在“飘扬”。

;

;“朝鲜也已写信给世界反兴奋剂机构，表示好吧，解释他们的立场，”他周日告诉记者。

;

;“我们也在从我们这边解释这一点。目前朝鲜国旗正在飘扬，我们将对此进行调查，看看未来会发生什么说。

;

;“让我告诉你，我们的目的是每个人都应该参与，每个人都应该有机会参与。

;

;”如果这次大流行发生了某些问题以及那个时期，所以我们应该考虑到这一点。”

;

;杭州亚运会是朝鲜自 2018 年雅加达亚运会以来参加的第一个国际综合运动会。

;

;朝鲜因未能派出代表队参加东京夏季奥运会而被取消国际奥委会 (IOC) 会员资格直至 2022 年底，并错过了去年的北京冬季奥运会。

;

;奥运会最初将接待来自俄罗斯和白俄罗斯的最多 500 名运动员，尽管在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后，俄罗斯和白俄罗斯对这两个国家的运动员实施了广泛的比赛禁令，莫斯科称之为“特别军事行动”。

;

;但是，国际奥委会在前往杭州之前确认，由于“后勤”问题，他们不会参加。

;

;辛格表示，运动员们“否则会受到热烈欢迎”，并为他们参加未来的亚运会敞开了大门。比赛。

;

;“OCA 正在调查此事，”以及组织者和政府，辛格在中国东部主办城市杭州举行的新闻发布会上表示。 “由于这是一个外交问题，他们正在调查此事。希望让我们看看，（是否）能带来好的结果。”

;

;来自阿鲁纳恰尔邦的三名武术运动员被授予印度外交部用钉书钉;签证;代替盖章签证说。印度不接受有效的装订签证。

;

;亚奥理事会道德委员会主席魏纪中上周对记者表示，中国没有拒绝运动员入境。

;

;在松散的纸上发放签证被视为中国质疑印度对阿鲁纳恰尔邦主权的方式。阿鲁纳恰尔邦位于中印边境附近，北京声称其是西藏的一部分。

;

;新德里强烈否认这一说法，称阿鲁纳恰尔邦一直是印度的一部分。

;

;北京和新德里于 1962 年因有争议的喜马拉雅边境爆发战争，此后一直是不安的邻居。 2020 年，两国关系因边境冲突而急转直下，导致 20 名印度士兵和 4 名中国士兵丧生。

;;纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫的12万名亚美尼亚人;将前往亚美尼亚，因为他们不想作为阿塞拜疆的一部分生活，并担心种族清洗，分离地区的领导人周日告诉路透社.

;

;发生了什么事，这意味着什么？

;

;卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚人被迫宣布<在闪电般的 24 小时后，9 月 20 日停火;规模大得多的阿塞拜疆军队的军事行动。

;

;“我们的人民不想作为阿塞拜疆的一部分生活。百分之九十九点九的人宁愿离开我们的历史土地，”萨姆维尔的顾问戴维·巴巴扬 (David Babayan)自封的阿尔扎赫共和国总统沙赫拉马尼扬对路透社表示。

;

;“我们穷人的命运将载入史册，成为亚美尼亚人民和整个文明社会的耻辱和耻辱。”世界，”巴巴扬说。

;

;阿塞拜疆表示将保障他们的权利并整合该地区，但亚美尼亚人表示他们担心镇压和种族清洗。阿塞拜疆否认有任何此类意图。

;

;随着苏联解体，亚美尼亚人和阿塞拜疆之间爆发了所谓的第一次卡拉巴赫战争（1988-1994）。约3万人死亡，超过100万人流离失所。

;

;The 120,000 ethnic Armenians of Nagorno-Karabakh will leave for Armenia as they do not want to live as part of Azerbaijan and fear ethnic cleansing, the leadership of the breakaway region told Reuters on Sunday.

;

;Armenia's Prime Minister also said the Karabakh Armenians were likely to leave the region, and that Armenia was ready to take them in, following a defeat last week at the hands of Azerbaijan in a conflict dating to the fall of the Soviet Union.

;

;The Armenians of Karabakh, a territory internationally recognised as part of Azerbaijan but previously beyond Baku's control, were forced to declare a ;ceasefire; on Sept. 20 after a lightning 24-hour military operation by the much larger Azerbaijani military.

;

;Azerbaijan says it will guarantee their rights and integrate the region, but the Armenians say they fear repression.

;

;"Our people do not want to live as part of Azerbaijan. Ninety-nine point nine percent prefer to leave our historic lands," David Babayan, an adviser to Samvel Shahramanyan, the president of the self-styled Republic of Artsakh, told Reuters.

;

;"The fate of our poor people will go down in history as a disgrace and a shame for the Armenian people and for the whole civilised world," Babayan said. "Those responsible for our fate will one day have to answer before God for their sins."

;

;The Armenian leaders of Karabakh said in a statement that all those made homeless by the Azerbaijani military operation and wanting to leave would be escorted to Armenia by Russian peacekeepers.

;

;Babayan said it was unclear when the population would move down the Lachin corridor which links the territory to Armenia, where Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan has faced calls to resign for failing to save Karabakh.

;

;In an address to the nation, Pashinyan said some humanitarian aid had arrived but the Armenians of Karabakh still faced "the danger of ethnic cleansing".

;

;"If real living conditions are not created for the Armenians of Nagorno-Karabakh in their homes and effective mechanisms of protection against ethnic cleansing, then the likelihood is increasing that the Armenians of Nagorno-Karabakh will see expulsion from their homeland as the only way out."

;

;Armenia "will lovingly welcome our brothers and sisters from Nagorno-Karabakh," Pashinyan said, according to Russia's TASS news agency.

;

;A mass exodus could change the delicate balance of power in the South Caucasus region, a patchwork of ethnicities crisscrossed with oil and gas pipelines where Russia, the United States, Turkey and Iran are jostling for influence.

;

;Last week's Azerbaijani victory appears to bring a decisive end to one of the decades-old "frozen conflicts" of the Soviet Union's dissolution.总统伊利哈姆·阿利耶夫表示，他的铁拳已经让亚美尼亚卡拉巴赫独立民族的想法成为历史，该地区将成为阿塞拜疆一部分的“天堂”。

;

;亚美尼亚表示，有 200 多人被困。阿塞拜疆军事行动造成 400 人死亡、400 人受伤。 The fate of the ethnic Armenian population has raised concerns in Moscow, Washington and Brussels.

;

;Nagorno-Karabakh, known as Artsakh by Armenians, lies in an area that over centuries has come under the sway of Persians, Turks, Russians, Ottomans and Soviets. It was claimed by both Azerbaijan and Armenia after the fall of the Russian Empire in 1917. In Soviet times it was designated an autonomous region within Azerbaijan.

;

;As the Soviet Union crumbled, the Armenians there threw off nominal Azeri control and captured neighbouring territory in what is now known as the First Karabakh War. From 1988-1994 about 30,000 people were killed and more than a million people, mostly Azeris, displaced.

;

;In 2020, after decades of skirmishes, Azerbaijan, backed by Turkey, won a decisive 44-day Second Karabakh War, recapturing territory in and around Karabakh. That war ended with a Russian-brokered peace deal, which Armenians accuse Moscow of failing to guarantee.

;

;The Armenian authorities in the region said late on Saturday that about 150 tons of humanitarian cargo from Russia and another 65 tons of flour shipped by the International Committee of the Red Cross had arrived in the region.

;

;"Given the scale of humanitarian needs, we are increasing our presence there with specialized personnel in health, forensics, protection, and weapons contamination," the ICRC said in a statement.

;

;With 2,000 peacekeepers in the region, Russia said that under the terms of the ceasefire six armoured vehicles, more than 800 small arms, anti-tank weapons and portable air defence systems, as well as 22,000 ammunition rounds had been handed in by Saturday.

;

;Pashinyan, who has publicly accused Russia of failing to support Armenia, said on Friday space for 40,000 people from Karabakh had been prepared in Armenia.

;

;Azerbaijan, which is mainly Muslim, has said the Armenians, who are Christian, can leave if they want.

;

;Around 20 ambulances are due to evacuate some of the wounded from Nagorno-Karabakh to Armenia, a humanitarian source who spoke on condition of anonymity told Reuters.

;

;US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, who has held urgent talks with Armenia and Azerbaijan, said on social media: "The United States will continue its steadfast support for Armenia and its sovereignty and territorial integrity."

;

;A senior Biden administration official said the US was on track to open the Vanuatu embassy by early next year and that other Vanuatu officials would attend the summit.

;

;Fiji has welcomed the stronger US regional presence as making the Pacific "more secure," but Kiribati, one of the most remote Pacific island states, 2,500 miles (4,000 km) southwest of Hawaii, said this year it plans to upgrade a former World War Two airstrip with Chinese assistance.

;

;Washington renewed agreements this year with Palau and Micronesia that give it exclusive military access to strategic parts of the Pacific, but has yet to do so with the Marshall Islands, which ;wants more money; to deal with the legacy of massive US nuclear testing in the 1940s and 50s.

;

;A Biden administration official said it was confident of concluding a deal with the Marshall Islands.
